A smart power strip that can detect when devices are not in use and automatically turn off to save energy. It can also be controlled remotely through an app, allowing users to turn off all devices at once with just a single tap.

A power strip with built-in USB charging ports, allowing users to charge multiple devices at once without the need for separate chargers. The strip also includes a power bank feature, allowing users to charge their devices on the go.

A power strip with a built-in fan, providing a cooling breeze for devices and helping to keep them from overheating. This can be especially useful in hot climates or for users who use their devices for extended periods of time.

A power strip with a built-in surge protector, providing extra protection for devices from power surges and spikes. This can help to prevent damage to devices and ensure they continue to function properly.

A power strip with a built-in Bluetooth speaker, allowing users to listen to music or take hands-free calls while charging their devices. The speaker can also be used to stream music from other devices, providing a convenient and portable audio solution.
